channel.title: Comments on: Go Seigen, Freedom and an AGA Online Tournament

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: These were the two games I saw that blew my mind. Game 1 is Go Seigen 8p v. Fujisawa Kuranosuke 6p, 1943-02-25. Game 2 is Fujisawa Kuranosuke 9p v. Go Seigen 9p, 1953-03-(11-13)
item.content:encoded:
These were the two games I saw that blew my mind.
Game 1 is Go Seigen 8p v. Fujisawa Kuranosuke 6p, 1943-02-25.
Game 2 is Fujisawa Kuranosuke 9p v. Go Seigen 9p, 1953-03-(11-13)

item.title: By: RisingStar
item.dc:creator: RisingStar
item.description: Just out of curiosity, Ben, which game of his do you find the most interesting a incredible? Maybe I could take a look.
item.content:encoded: Just out of curiosity, Ben, which game of his do you find the most interesting a incredible? Maybe I could take a look.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Thank you for the advice! I definitely don't plan on trying to copy him by any means. xD Haha. The man's reading ability was nothing short of incredible. His strategies are often planned many many moves in advanced. I have problems even planning 5 moves ahead! =D I will definitely add 9-Dan Showdown to the list! Thank you for the recommendation!
item.content:encoded:
Thank you for the advice! I definitely don’t plan on trying to copy him by any means. xD Haha. The man’s reading ability was nothing short of incredible. His strategies are often planned many many moves in advanced. I have problems even planning 5 moves ahead! =D
I will definitely add 9-Dan Showdown to the list! Thank you for the recommendation!

item.title: By: aconley
item.dc:creator: aconley
item.description: Be careful. One piece of pro advice I've heard is that Go Seigen's games should be appreciated, not emulated, because if you try to play like him you will lose a lot --because you are not Go Seigen. And that's apparently even true at the pro level. If you want to see a lot more of such trades, read 9-dan Showdown by John Fairbairn.
item.content:encoded:
Be careful. One piece of pro advice I’ve heard is that Go Seigen’s games should be appreciated, not emulated, because if you try to play like him you will lose a lot –because you are not Go Seigen. And that’s apparently even true at the pro level.
If you want to see a lot more of such trades, read 9-dan Showdown by John Fairbairn.
